contents.name: Figure [PrD-01] Product ABEs Level 1
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Product Domain::Figure [PrD-01] Product ABEs Level 1

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: The diagram below lists the Product Domain's ABEs....

ownedComment.body:
The diagram below lists the Product Domain's ABEs.
[] Product Party Roles ABE • Product Party Roles ABE contains all PartyRoles related to the Product Domain such as ProductManager. [] Product Specification ABE • The Product Specification ABE contains all entities that represent a product specification as perceived by the business user and specifies what the marketing operator wants to sell at a functional level (i.e. what are the capacities, which usages are available…). [] Product Offering ABE • The Product Offering ABE describes tangible and intangible goods made available for a certain price to the market in the form of product catalogs. This ABE is also responsible for targeting market segments based on the appropriate market strategy. [] Product ABE • Represents an instance in the product inventory of a product offering or specification subscribed to by a party role, such as a customer, the place where the product is in use, as well as configuration characteristics, such as assigned telephone numbers and internet addresses. The Product ABE also tracks the services and/or resources through which the product is realized. [] Product Usage ABE • Represents usage of products associated with Customers used for charging that may appear on a Customer Bill. [] Loyalty ABE • A loyalty program is one of the tools used by the loyalty process to retain customers. The Loyalty ABE contains all entities useful to specify and instantiate loyalty programs. A LoyaltyProgramProdSpec defines the LoyaltyRules that have to be checked in order to identify the actions to apply. Depending on the type of LoyaltyRules a LoyaltyAccount might be needed to collect gains or not. A LoyaltyProgramProduct is a type of ProductComponent and described by a LoyaltyProgramProdSpec. [] Product Configuration ABE • The definition of how a Product operates or functions in terms of CharacteristicSpecification(s) and related ResourceSpec(s), ProductSpec(s), ServiceSpec(s) as well as a representation of how a Product operates or functions in terms of characteristics and related Resource(s), Product(s), Service(s). [] Product Test ABE • A product test is a function performed on a product that results in measures being produced that reflect the functioning of the product under test. [] Product Performance ABE (not fully developed) • The Product Performance ABE handles product performance goals, the results of end-to-end product performance assessments, and the comparison of assessments against goals. The results may include the identification of potential capacity issues. [] Strategic Product Portfolio Plan ABE (not fully developed) • A strategy employed to promote a ProductOffering. Strategic Product Portfolio Plan ABE is concerned with the plans of the product portfolio, which product offerings to make available to each market segment and the plans to development and deploy product offerings, as well as retirement of products.

contents.name: Figure [PrD-02] Product ABEs Level 1 & 2
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Product Domain::Figure [PrD-02] Product ABEs Level 1 & 2

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: The diagram below lists the Product Domain's ABEs Level 1 & 2....

ownedComment.body:
The diagram below lists the Product Domain's ABEs Level 1 & 2.
[] Network Product ABE • The Network Product ABE contains the NetworkProduct description and relationships. [] Product Price ABE • The Product Price ABE describes all the prices applied to Products. [] Usage Volume Product ABE • The Usage Volume Product ABE contains the UsageVolumeProduct and all the entities specific to this type of product. [] Loyalty Program ABE • The Loyalty Program ABE contains all entities needed to instantiate a loyalty program for a specific customer such as LoyaltyProgram and LoyaltyAccount. [] Loyalty Program Specification ABE • The Loyalty Program Specification ABE contains all entities specifying a loyalty program such as LoyaltyProgramProdSpec and LoyaltyRule. [] Network Product Spec ABE • The Network Product Spec ABE contains the NetworkProductSpec description and relationships. [] Usage Volume Product Spec ABE • The Usage Volume Product Spec ABE contains the UsageVolumeProductSpec and all the entities specific to this type of product. [] Product Action ABE • The Product Action ABE contains Business Entities describing possible actions for ProductSpecifications, ProductOfferings and ProductConfigSpecs. [] Product Usage Spec ABE • The Product Usage Spec ABE specifies types of usage of ProductSpecifications. [] Product Catalog ABE • Product Catalog ABE is a collection of entities that represent the specification of ProductCatalogs and catalogs described by them that contain ProductOfferings and their associated ProductOfferingPrices. [] Product Offering Price ABE • The Product Offering Price ABE describes all the prices related to ProductOfferings. [] Product Offering Price Rule ABE • The Product Offering Price Rule ABE describes all rules related to prices concerning ProductOfferings. [] Pricing Logic Algorithm ABE • The Pricing Logic Algorithm ABE contains entities representing an instantiation of an interface specification to external rating function (without a modeled bahavior in SID). [] Product Placement ABE • The Product Placement ABE gives a description of how ProductOfferings are marketed, such as via direct mail. A ProductPlacement contains qualitative statements, or assessments that describe such things as market penetration, product strategy, and so forth. [] Product Promotion ABE • The Product Promotion ABE describes the publication of a ProductOffering to encourage Parties to buy, rent, or in some other way procure the offering.

The Product domain represents roles, information and activities carried out by parties (e.g. individuals / organizations) playing roles that are involved in the strategic planning, definition, development and operational aspects of Products that are offered. Activities include management of Product: strategies, capabilities, lifecycles, offerings, instances, performance, contract operations, usage statistics and support of goods and services (products) that are offered to customers by an enterprise. <Note> Note that Products covers 2 cases: 1) Products bought by a Customer to the Service Provider, 2) Products bought by the Service Provider to Business Partners.</Note> In looking at ‘Product’ for the SID model, the modelers looked at Product concepts in the eTOM and member company offerings and implementations. The key concepts that were looked at were the detailed specification of products (ProductSpecifications); the way in which they are offered into the market (ProductOfferings); and the way in which they are maintained and perform while in use (Products). The SID model reflects Product entities from a business-oriented point-of-view and uses the best of standard modeling patterns for this area.
